Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Romance in the Old West
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting, characters, and initial conflicts related to romance, work, and the changing landscape of the old West.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction and Romance Rejection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Nan, a strong-willed woman, in a Western setting with modern hints, and her rejection of romantic advances, prioritizing her work.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and the Stubborn Woman

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Departure and Reflections
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan's decision to go to the ghost town alone and her internal thoughts about her past visits, contrasting her current feelings with past experiences.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflections on the Ghost Town

Major_Arcs.title: Modernization vs. Preservation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a modern setting and introduces the central conflict of modernization threatening the historical Ghost Town with the planned construction of an airport.

sub_scenes.title: Modern Day Announcement and Reaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the modern reality of the ghost town's impending destruction and Nan's emotional breakdown upon hearing the news.

narrative_arcs.title: Disbelief, Explanation, and Nan's Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Family Conflict and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's family and romantic conflicts, including reconciliation with Cal and confrontations with her father regarding the ghost town and her personal choices.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation with Cal and Arrival at Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan and Cal's reconciliation and Nan's arrival at the ghost town, now transformed by construction.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Arrival at the Transformed Ghost Town and Dismay

sub_scenes.title: Family and Labor Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Nan's conflict with her father over the airport project and her forced participation in it, leading to emotional distress.

sub_scenes.title: Parental and Maid's Advice & Nan's Decision
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves Nan receiving advice from her mother and a maid, leading to her resolve to understand her feelings for Cal and seek him out.

narrative_arcs.title: Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Confession and Weather Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Nan and Cal's romantic confession amidst personal and environmental challenges, leading to a community-wide crisis and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Loneliness
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan and Cal's heartfelt conversation, Nan's impulsive action, and her subsequent loneliness after a period of coldness towards Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Defensiveness in the Snow

sub_scenes.title: Weather Crisis and Community Response
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a severe weather crisis, community concern, and Cal's decisive action to address the impending starvation.

narrative_arcs.title: Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst the Storm

sub_scenes.title: Hope and Relief with 'Operation Hay Lift'
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the despair and sudden hope brought by 'Operation Hay Lift', leading to joyful relief and romantic resolution for Nan and Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Waking Up to Snow and Hopelessness
The Sound of a Plane and Hopeful Fodder Drop
Joyful Recognition of Fodder and Cal's Foresight

Major_Arcs.title: The Ballad of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and his impact on a town, focusing on his actions, reputation, and the unfolding drama involving Jeff and Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Local Reactions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through his actions and the varied opinions of the townspeople, establishing his character and initial impact.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Past and Gun Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into Jeff's past influences and his current fascination with guns, leading to a confrontation with Sally about his behavior and Clyde Surrett.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Jeff's Brother and Past

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Fear, Clyde's Reassurance, and Jeff's Disappearance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene highlights Sally's deep concern for Jeff and her plea to Clyde, followed by a moment of reassurance and the sudden disappearance of Jeff.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Fear and Plea to Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Newspaper Article and Town Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a newspaper article that causes town gossip and conflict, leading to Sally's confrontation with Clyde about it and Benson's explanation for his presence.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense of Past Actions and Article Mention
Warning about Benson and the Article

sub_scenes.title: Journalistic Duty and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Benson's justification of his journalistic duty and Sally's unexpected dinner invitation, setting up a potential gathering.

narrative_arcs.title: Article's Impact and Doubts about Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Conflict and Mistaken Identity Reveal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene builds tension at the dinner table and reveals a romantic encounter with Chane Benson, culminating in Sally's shocking realization of mistaken identity.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation, Fight, and Rescue Mission
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Jeff's jealous confrontation, a physical fight, and Sally's urgent realization that Clyde is in danger, initiating a rescue mission.

sub_scenes.title: Fair Fight and Newspaper Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene resolves the conflict through a fair fight challenge and a subsequent newspaper headline change, leading to a sense of family legacy in journalism.

narrative_arcs.title: Challenge for a Fair Fight and Anxious Wait
Printing the Clarion and Family Legacy

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Reluctant Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Steve Daley and Betsy in a range war conflict, exploring themes of authority, suspicion, and a romance developing amidst danger.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and Ranch Tensions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Steve Daley in a ranch setting, highlighting initial conflicts and rising tensions related to range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as 'The Boss'
Discussion of Betsy's Ranch and Approaching Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Suspicion, Ride Offer, and Hank's Orders
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves clarifying Steve's role, discussing range war concerns, offering a ride, and detailing Hank's orders in town.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarifying Steve Daley's Role and Concerns
Discussion of Impending Range War and Local Troubles
Offer of a Ride and Acceptance
Hank's Orders and Waiting for Dress Material

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Steve's Skills
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a post-shopping conversation, a sudden confrontation with Fred Bridges, and a display of Steve Daley's fighting abilities.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Purchase Conversation and Steve Daley Mention
Discussion of Steve Daley's Abilities and Impending Danger

sub_scenes.title: Bodyguard Decision and Stance on Gunslingers
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals Betsy's decision to hire Steve as bodyguard and her philosophy against gunslingers, leading to Hank's gratitude and personnel changes.

narrative_arcs.title: Decision to Hire Bodyguard and Ranch Philosophy
Clarification on Firing and Stance Against Gunslingers
Gratitude, Personnel Change, and Hank Yuh's Request

sub_scenes.title: Gun Ultimatum and Confession of Love
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents Betsy's ultimatum regarding Steve's guns, leading to emotional pleas, mutual confessions of love, and a difficult dilemma.

narrative_arcs.title: Love's Proof and Surrender of Guns

sub_scenes.title: War Declaration and Hank's Ambush
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene escalates the range war with ominous warnings, accusations, declarations of war, and the ambush and capture of Hank.

narrative_arcs.title: Declaration of War and Betsy's Authority

sub_scenes.title: Rescue Attempt and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Betsy's desperation to stop Steve, his resolve to rescue Hank, the ensuing confrontation at Devil's Pass, and the romantic resolution between Steve and Betsy amidst the crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Aftermath and Suspense at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Contract of Love and Beef
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores Carrie and Fred's complex relationship intertwined with business contracts, betrayal, and eventual reconciliation through emotional honesty and sacrifice.

sub_scenes.title: Accusation and Concern for Curley
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene starts with Mary's accusation towards Dave and shifts to concern about Curley's unusual behavior, setting up initial tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Unexpected Encounter
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on a fence dispute, leading to an unexpected encounter with Fred Gordon and escalating tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Unexpected Visitors and Accusation of Fence Damage

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Interlude Interrupted
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the immediate aftermath of the fence confrontation, a romantic interlude between Dave and Carrie, and its sudden interruption by Fred Gordon.

narrative_arcs.title: Confusion about Friendship and Second Chances
Romantic Interlude and Dismissal of Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Confession of Love and Flashback Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves a conversation about Dave, a confession of love for Fred Gordon, and a flashback to Carrie and Fred's romantic proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love for Fred Gordon
Desire to Bury the Hatchet and Romantic Overture
Flashback to Romantic Words and Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Contract Manipulation and Betrayal Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Fred and Carrie discussing the Carlton contract, leading to Carrie's realization of Fred's manipulation and her emotional confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Dave and the Carlton Contract

sub_scenes.title: Office Confrontation and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Carrie's confrontation with Mr. Carlton and Fred in the office, leading to her emotional breakdown and apparent concession, ultimately resolving the contract conflict and romantic tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office

sub_scenes.title: Final Confrontation and Indirect Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves Carrie's final confrontation with Fred, an encounter with Dave, and Carrie's indirect confession of love for Fred, followed by her abrupt departure and a flashback.

narrative_arcs.title: Apology and Inquiry about Feelings for Fred
Wagon Ride and Direct Confrontation about Love

sub_scenes.title: Illness, Revelation, and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the arc with Carrie's illness, a revelation about the beef contract, and a romantic reunion with Fred, resolving their romantic conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: The Beef Contract Revelation and Reconciliation with Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Escape, Pursuit, and True Love's Test
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Dirk and Chris in a dangerous escape, focusing on themes of brotherly care, moral dilemmas, pursuit, and the ultimate test of Chris and Ransom's love.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Plea and Secret Meeting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Dirk's urgent plea to Carrie and transitions to a secret nighttime meeting, setting up a clandestine operation.

narrative_arcs.title: Dirk's Urgent Arrival and Plea for Help
The Secret Meeting and Dirk's Disguise
Dirk's Gunshot Wound and Medical Examination

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Marshal's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows an investigation into Dirk's situation and the arrival of Marshal Ransom at the ranch, escalating the stakes and pursuit.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Investigation into Dirk's Situation
Marshal Ransom's Arrival and Inquiry about Dirk
Confrontation with Rance Cready and Suspicion at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Legal Stance and Plea for Leniency
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves Marshal Ransom's legal stance on Dirk's case and the woman's plea for leniency, setting up a negotiation regarding Dirk's fate.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts between heated argument and romantic confession between Chris and Ransom, leading to Chris proposing an escape plan for Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Escape Plan Proposal and Seeming Agreement

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Gunfight, and Moral Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the chase, confrontation, gunfight, and the moral dilemma of whether to kill the injured Marshal to ensure escape.

sub_scenes.title: Escape Facilitation and Return of Love
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Chris helping Dirk escape, her unexpected return to Ransom, and their final romantic resolution amidst the crisis.
